intro: Acyntha longiflora, commonly known as the long-flowered acyntha, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family, characterized by its hairy stems and blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or dry soils and is often found in open fields and along coastal areas. Its flowers are tubular and clustered in racemes, attracting various pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Acyntha longiflora is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been used in traditional herbal medicine for its purported health benefits.
